anamarias joined #xwiki at 11:01  
bblfish - (11:02): ok, got a form to create a public private key in the XWikiUserProfileSheet , that should the public key back to Xwiki. Now I need to create a page that knows how to parse the formats. I have the java code for that. But how do I integrate it into xwiki?  
bblfish - (11:11): so presumably I would have to write a plugin  
tmortagne - (11:13): bblfish: plugins are supposed to be the old way, you should use components now. See http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Modules/ComponentModule  
tmortagne - (11:14): unless what you want to provide is an authenticator which is neither a plugin or a component (not yet)  
bblfish - (11:15): now, the authenticators will be for later. First get people to create keys.  
bblfish - (11:15): thanks for the pointer, ...  
tmortagne - (11:16): another way is to write your code in groovy or velocity of course  
arkub left at 11:16 (Quit: Leaving  
arkub joined #xwiki at 11:18  
bblfish - (11:22): I'd rather stick to one language :-) and if I had to I'd rather do scala.  
tmortagne - (11:23): bblfish: make me think is did not check since a long time if scala provide a JSR223 support  
KermitTheFragger joined #xwiki at 11:24  
bblfish - (11:25): I asked on their #irc channel, but they did not seem to know there  
bblfish - (11:25): #scala  
bblfish - (11:25): here is the java file btw: http://github.com/harbulot/keygenapp/blob/master/base/src/main/java/uk/ac/manchester/\_rcs/bruno/keygenapp/base/MiniCaCertGen.java  
bblfish - (11:32): ah, here is the Servlet http://github.com/harbulot/keygenapp/blob/master/samplewebapp/src/main/java/uk/ac/manchester/\_rcs/bruno/keygenapp/webapp/MiniCaServlet.java  
tmortagne - (11:33): found https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/SLING-1274 but it's for sling and not for scala  
bblfish - (11:35): I am not sure the #scala people think of it as a scripting language... But I am not sure how one tells the difference

tmortagne - (14:20): could i have more votes on "[VOTE] Use current database  instead of current document database in Current\*ReferenceResolver" ? I would like to do it in 2.2, otherwise it will be impossible to change the behavior in 2.3 branch

florinciu left at 18:32 (Ping timeout: 252 seconds  
glerouge - (18:32): hi guys  
sdumitriu - (18:32): Hi glerouge  
glerouge - (18:32): I'm trying to do the following in Lucne  
glerouge - (18:33): searchTermA OR searchTermB  
glerouge - (18:33): when I input this I only get results for searchTermB  
glerouge - (18:33): same with searchTermA searchTermB  
glerouge - (18:33): I only get results for the second one  
glerouge - (18:34): whereas searchTermA AND searchTermB works just fine  
sdumitriu - (18:35): Works for me  
glerouge - (18:35): I think it's because I modified the search page  
sdumitriu - (18:35): You shouldn't do that  
glerouge - (18:36): to add an extra clause  
sdumitriu - (18:36): You're not a programmer  
glerouge - (18:36): I copied it to a custom one  
glerouge - (18:36): lol, can I get your help then? ;)  
sdumitriu - (18:36): Depends  
sdumitriu - (18:36): What do you offer?  
glerouge - (18:36): not much  
glerouge - (18:37): I expect your sense of professional conscience to be enough  
glerouge - (18:37): (and the fact that you can't stand lousy code)  
glerouge - (18:37): (+ you like correcting my mistakes on the mailing list anyway)  
glerouge - (18:41): ok I know  
glerouge - (18:41): what I'm doing wrong  
sdumitriu - (18:41): Glad to have helped  
glerouge - (18:42): you haven't - yet  
glerouge - (18:42): I'm overloading the query and actually doing  
sdumitriu - (18:42): Sure I did  
sdumitriu - (18:42): It helps trying to speak with me  
glerouge - (18:42): searchTermA OR searchTermB AND someParameter:valueC  
glerouge - (18:43): can I somehow enclose searchTermA OR searchTermB in brackets or something ?  
sdumitriu - (18:43): Yes  
sdumitriu - (18:43): Lucene allows it  
glerouge - (18:43): what's the sytnax?  
sdumitriu - (18:43): (a OR B) AND c  
glerouge - (18:44): ok, let me try that  
glerouge - (18:46): and… it works :)  
glerouge - (18:47): now you've helped me

CalebJamesDeLisl - (20:29): In a wiki farm, what rights do admins of virtual wikis usually have? Admin but not programming?  
sdumitriu - (20:31): Yes  
sdumitriu - (20:31): Programming is only for global users  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (20:32): Thanks.
